It provides a sophisticated mechanism for ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"tracking Python module dependencies at runtime","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" by intercepting the import process and building a comprehensive dependency graph.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c3fbed7b-3e82-4b34-b539-ece362d45b6b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"What system:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f77ae7e8-6bd2-4f7c-9c40-d668db8676aa","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"javascript"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│   Python's Import System (sys.path, sys.modules)    │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│   Custom Loader (CustomLoader)                      │
│   └─ Hooks into module loading events              │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│   ImportManager (Orchestrator)                      │
│   ├─ Graph Operations                              │
│   ├─ Import Processing                             │
│   └─ System Configuration                          │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│   Dependency Graph (import_graph dictionary)        │
│   └─ Nodes: modules | Edges: import relationships  │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c4cf6fd8-c17e-49a0-acb7-2d340f60da6d","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"11c19161-bff5-4b9c-ba7c-bd107c678a25","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Core Components","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ea7ef18d-aa57-4ee9-8c9d-d5875382c587","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"1. ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CustomLoader","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (via ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_custom_loader()","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":")","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0eaa069f-a52d-4df8-ace7-5ab9fce654f9","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Role:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The bridge between Python's import system and your analysis.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"05bd0e19-1ad4-4f33-97ec-628b0511fffb","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Responsibilities:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8103fe5c-dd36-4d6d-90fb-46dbe5235bb9","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Intercepts module loading events","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"296f4c69-944d-497c-8060-f7d0f8aa30ea","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Creates graph nodes and edges when modules are discovered","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fcf46633-1674-41b1-8974-12fdda4c4355","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Records module file paths for later reference","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"e53d9506-d268-41e5-9bd1-ad15d24cc4bb","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Quick Introduction:

","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"When Python loads a module, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CustomLoader","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is notified and immediately registers that module in the dependency graph. This happens transparently—the module loads normally while we capture the relationship data.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"cbe73408-eba3-411f-8a67-d344a94b59df","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"For detailed information","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":", see the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_custom_loader","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"CustomLoader","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" documentation.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f10410c3-ae2b-48ee-8bb5-9a7b82a71705","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"9b4ce7e1-a6a7-461a-b730-744278a48a09","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":3,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"2. ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ImportManager","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (The Core Orchestrator)","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a5994c28-5819-445b-98a7-59e0f27b127b","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Role:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" The main controller that coordinates all import analysis activities.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8394e084-5ae3-4e8e-90c5-53a044d9daa1","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Key Responsibilities:","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"91f275eb-6afb-421a-8774-01ff6d2a13f9","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Manages the dependency graph (creation, querying, updates)","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8fc750f3-4c56-46cb-ae15-1f136aacc88e","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Orchestrates the import resolution process","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2fe73cfe-06cc-4eeb-9a93-e7fb1a20f9f1","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Configures and controls Python's import system hooks","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6259c424-46b1-472f-811a-ca4bbe1baf33","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Maintains module metadata","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3e0d0b20-c248-4a63-88da-631584b28516","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Quick Introduction:

","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"ImportManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is where you start. You instantiate it, configure it with your project directory, install hooks, and then let it capture imports. After analysis, you retrieve the built dependency graph from it.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"83f87f1d-2826-4275-872e-492c6bf7a033","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"76e82428-2d25-4c1e-95de-34e7cbb66a6c","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":4,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"ImportManager Groups","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"(Brief Overview)","styles":{"italic":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4c92b2b8-6ebc-441c-bca1-0fbd1b656f82","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ImportManager","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" class is organized into three functional groups:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"a7f74704-b07b-4fe6-ab1f-adbb3a1b6905","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":5,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Group A: Graph Data Management","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"93f22b30-83da-47a6-af5f-37f6b633cfa0","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Directly handles the dependency graph structure. ","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"When something goes wrong during import analysis—like attempting to create a module node twice—an ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ImportManagerError","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is raised. This helps you identify what went wrong and where.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f5d25cb1-7ccc-4b8a-92a5-906b0f5e701f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"For detailed information","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":", see the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"ImportManagerError","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" documentation.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4183e028-6e2f-4834-a1c2-41b986012a7e","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"01dc384b-401e-42ad-858e-fdc2fc691a0b","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Basic Usage Flow","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"91e762ef-52dd-4833-a672-8e99bad12499","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Here's how the components work together:","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bba3d9df-231d-47ed-aaf9-a60dbc84d800","type":"codeBlock","props":{"language":"python"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"# Step 1: Create and configure the manager
manager = ImportManager()
manager.set_pkg("/path/to/project")

# Step 2: Install hooks (CustomLoader activates)
manager.install_hooks()

# Step 3: Execute code or import modules
# CustomLoader intercepts each import, updating the graph

# Step 4: Query the results
graph = manager.get_import_graph()
dependencies = manager.get_imports("my_module")

# Step 5: Clean up
manager.remove_hooks()","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"d0ddf642-0900-4ef3-926e-635788211e9d","type":"divider","props":{},"children":[]},{"id":"338430ea-c5c6-4830-b004-4a0214347c9d","type":"heading","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left","level":2,"isToggleable":false},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How
